title: Beyond the Pages, KPR Institute Engineering and Technology, Autonomous Engineering Institution, Coimbatore, India
paragraphs: The event saw enthusiastic participation from 11 teams, each demonstrating their creativity and design skills. Participants were challenged to create book covers inspired by Hollywood films, allowing them to reimagine iconic movies in a visual format. Using advanced design tools like Figma, Illustrator, CorelDRAW, and Canva, students showcased impressive levels of creativity, attention to detail, and technical prowess.

The event provided a platform for students to explore digital design techniques and express their artistic interpretation of movie-based themes. Each cover design reflected the student’s unique perspective on the film, effectively translating cinematic narratives into captivating visual representations. Held in the VLSI Classroom, the competition was both engaging and educational, giving participants a chance to apply design concepts and digital artistry in a collaborative and creative setting.

World is transforming everyday. In the rapidly evolving engineering landscape, we have an Increased responsibility to transform the engineering education from traditional curriculum to meet the 21st century skills like Creativity, Critical Thinking, Collaboration and Communication. Through our unique and strategic approach we enable our students to learn beyond and prepare them for life long success.
